title: Implement GRIN dead code elimination
body:
Implement dead code and dead data elimination using HPT results.

**Deliverables:**
- Remove unreachable function definitions (not called from `main`)
- Remove unused variables (bound but never referenced)
- Remove dead constructor fields (fields that are never `fetch`ed)
- Remove unused case alternatives (tags that HPT proves can never appear)
- Preserve program semantics (don't remove side-effecting code)
- Unit tests showing code size reduction

**Design notes:**
- This is the first optimisation pass to implement — highest impact per effort
- GRIN's whole-program nature makes this more effective than per-module DCE
- Dead data field elimination is unique to GRIN — it can remove individual fields from constructors
